conclusion: Initial position of light source casts shadows A, B, C, and D to the left of objects.
Shadows are formed due to obstruction of light by objects, projecting onto surface below.
Movement of light source to the right changes direction of light rays.
New light rays from right affect position and shape of shadows.
Shadows will shift to the left as light source moves to the right.
Shadow A will move to the left of the cake.
Shadow B will move to the left of the envelope.
Shadow C will move to the left of the cylinder.
Shadow D will move to the left of the soccer ball.
Size of shadows may change depending on angle of light source.
If light source height remains constant, shadows maintain size but shift in position.
Final shadow configuration: shadows positioned to the left of respective objects.
Size of shadows remains relatively the same if height of light source does not change significantly.
Final Answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D shift to the left of objects; size remains unchanged if light source height is constant.
